pullrequest.title: Syntax highlighting: basic syntax highlighter based on "log levels" regexps

content.raw:
“Highlights” = “colorizes”, obviously.

Uses bold and italics variously for more severe messages.

Motivation: The device driver I’ve written is chatty in its BLACS console. Tracebacks stand out of course in red but give code-level information. Exception handling gives us a chance to provide physics-level info, separate from the code-level info \(as we do elsewhere with Raise LabscriptError, “advice”\), but this info gets overlooked because of the traceback. Making it a different colour lets us make useful “physics” advice from exception handling stand out, before allowing the python exception to take place and report what the lower-level consequence was for the driver. I don’t want to preempt the driver exception.

“Highlights” = “colorizes”, obviously.

Uses bold and italics variously for more severe messages.

Motivation: The device driver I’ve written is chatty in its BLACS console. Tracebacks stand out of course in red but give code-level information. Exception handling gives us a chance to provide physics-level info, separate from the code-level info (as we do elsewhere with Raise LabscriptError, “advice”), but this info gets overlooked because of the traceback. Making it a different colour lets us make useful “physics” advice from exception handling stand out, before allowing the python exception to take place and report what the lower-level consequence was for the driver. I don’t want to preempt the driver exception.
